call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Weekly Update & AMA - May 8th

topics.title: Node 6.0 Release Progress and Voting
topics.summary: kushti discusses recent releases 5.0.26 and 5.1.3, cleanup work for 6.0, and plans for miner voting to begin end of May/June 1st. Explains the three-month voting process and how miners need to configure their nodes with voting parameters.

topics.title: Sub-blocks Development and P2P Protocol
topics.summary: kushti explains sub-blocks implementation work, focusing on efficient propagation of new blocks and peer-to-peer logic improvements. Discusses the need to switch to announcing only new transactions rather than full blocks for efficiency.

topics.title: Public Testnet and Devnet Plans
topics.summary: Discussion about need for multiple miners on public testnet and devnet for testing competition scenarios. Plans to test mixed environments with some miners on sub-block supporting clients and others on standard clients.

topics.title: Dexy Contracts and Real-World Applications
topics.summary: kushti updates on Dexy contract deployment and discusses ongoing talks with entities interested in real-world asset tokenization, insurance schemes, and governance systems for African cooperatives. Mentions mesh networks for offline digital cash payments.

topics.title: Web3 Philosophy and Use Cases
topics.summary: kushti critiques current Web3 implementation, arguing that 99% of use cases don't need tokens or blockchain. Advocates for proper Web3 being about mesh networks, Nostr, IPFS, and using blockchain as global settlement layer, referencing Hal Finney's 2010 ideas.

topics.title: Database Options: LevelDB vs RocksDB
topics.summary: Discussion of node database options, with RocksDB being more stable and better for SSDs, while LevelDB supports more platforms and may be better for HDDs. kushti shares history of IODB database development at IOG and why they switched to standard options.

topics.title: Sigma Chains and Developer Expansion
topics.summary: kushti discusses plans to extend Ergo's contractual layer to support different execution environments and other blockchains. Mentions off-chain contract execution possibilities and references early ideas from smartcontract.com days with Chainlink founders.

topics.title: Off-chain Execution and Trust Models
topics.summary: Explanation of how off-chain contract execution could work with collateral locked until conditions are satisfied. Discusses trust requirements and comparison to oracle systems, emphasizing suitability for small community environments where trust is less problematic.

topics.title: ErgoHack 10 AI Focus
topics.summary: Discussion of upcoming ErgoHack 10 with AI theme starting May 20th. qx() highlights opportunities for AI integration including auto-generation of artwork, blockchain querying tools, and development assistance for project leaders with zero coding knowledge.

topics.title: Rosen Treasury Proposals Analysis
topics.summary: Detailed discussion of four Rosen treasury proposals aimed at increasing liquidity, SPO rewards, and getting more ERG holders on Cardano to meet Kraken listing requirements. Emphasizes strategic benefits for ecosystem growth and exchange listings.

topics.title: BASIS and ChainCash Explanation
topics.summary: kushti explains BASIS as an extension of ChainCash for encouraging blockchain banking with standard notes. Discusses trust models, reserve backing, and how participants have freedom to accept or reject notes, unlike enforced government currencies.

topics.title: ChainCash Risk and Default Scenarios
topics.summary: Discussion of what happens when trusted ChainCash entities fail, comparing to subprime mortgage crashes. kushti explains difficulty in defining defaults, citing examples of failed currencies still being used (Somalia central bank, Terra Luna Classic).

topics.title: Sub-blocks Timeline and Deployment
topics.summary: kushti provides timeline for sub-blocks testing, suggesting possible deployment next week for public devnet. Emphasizes trade-off between fast deployment and stability, with willingness to deploy experimental versions for short-term testing.

topics.title: Marketing Plans and Community Efforts
topics.summary: Discussion of marketing needs for Ergo, especially around sub-blocks. qx() calls for Twitter volunteers and community content creation, while kushti mentions upcoming Twitter spaces and ideas for promoting high-performance proof of work.

topics.title: Rosen vs Bitcoin OS Bridge Comparison
topics.summary: Analysis of different bridge approaches, comparing Rosen's watcher-guard model to Bitcoin OS's SNARK-based system. kushti discusses mass exit scenarios, complexity trade-offs, and implementation risks, referencing past Zcash circuit bugs.

topics.title: Ergo Hash Rate and Security Concerns
topics.summary: Discussion of Ergo's hash rate sustainability as rewards decrease. kushti explains difficulty comparing current hash rates to early Ergo due to Autolykos v1 vs v2 switch and increasing RAM requirements over time affecting mining dynamics.
